Note: Date of issue based on the dates of the Liberty Loan campaign. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Text tells the advantages of buying a Liberty bond. It says pay now and forget about it and every six months for twenty years you can cash a coupon with $2.12 on every one hundred dollar bond, or $4.25 a year in interest. The more you buy now, the happier and richer you will be. Illustration shows a family sitting at a table listening to the father as he explains to the family the benefits.  Design for a newspaper advertisement for the Liberty Loan.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I

Title: When the bonds mature
